entry.title: SAP SuccessFactors HCM: Updated Home Page 2H 2025
entry.content:
The second half of 2025 marks a major milestone for SAP SuccessFactors HCM: the launch of a refreshed, smarter, and more intuitive home page experience. Designed to help employees, managers, and HR administrators work more efficiently, this update streamlines navigation, personalizes content, and makes every interaction smoother.

And before you read further, I‚Äôm sure every SAP SuccessFactors customer is wondering whether this has full parity with the current home page. I‚Äôm happy to say that yes, it does! Perhaps this is a great opportunity for you to review what is working and maybe not working with what you have in your current home page, and include those changes when you roll out this version.

We‚Äôre excited for you to explore the new home page and see just how much easier your day-to-day work can be, with faster navigation, personalized shortcuts, and dynamic content that surfaces the information and tasks you need most. By streamlining actions and tailoring your experience, the updated home page helps you work smarter and stay focused on what matters most!

Smarter, Faster Actions

The updated Quick Actions are designed to anticipate what you need most. Whether it‚Äôs approving time off, updating personal details, or managing team requests, the system automatically surfaces relevant tasks‚Äîsaving time and reducing clicks. And now, these Quick Actions are also available in SAP SuccessFactors Work Zone, extending the HR experience into your broader workspace.

 

 

A Clean, Modern Design

The redesigned layout features a modern look with consistent card design, clearer hierarchy, and a cleaner presentation of information. It‚Äôs easier on the eyes, simpler to navigate, and built for how people work today.

 

 

Dynamic, Personalized Content

Banners and custom cards can bring your home page to life‚Äîperfect for company news, team updates, or leadership messages. Content is dynamic, so each user sees what‚Äôs most relevant to them, keeping the experience focused.

 

 

Tailored to You

With new personalization options, users can customize their home page, save bookmarks, and receive personalized recommendations tailored to their skills and career goals. The new ‚ÄúRequests for Me‚Äù section ensures time-sensitive tasks‚Äîlike approvals or surveys‚Äîare always visible.

 

Consistent on Mobile

The mobile app now mirrors the web experience, offering a seamless transition between devices. A new splash screen, updated navigation, and consolidated task view make it easier than ever to stay productive on the go‚Äîwhether on iOS or Android.

 

Why It Matters

This update isn‚Äôt just a design refresh‚Äîit‚Äôs a more intelligent, role-aware experience that helps people get work done faster and with less effort. You‚Äôll see:

  • Improved productivity through faster task completion.
  • A contextual experience that reduces distractions.
  • Easier customization without complex setup.
  • Flexible rollout options so organizations can adopt at their own pace.

Getting Started

To prepare for rollout, start with early preview and testing in sandbox environments. Map existing content to new cards, identify gaps, and engage your users early. Use in-app guidance with WalkMe for SAP SuccessFactors HCM to make the transition seamless.

Explore the New Experience

The updated SAP SuccessFactors HCM home page is more than a fresh coat of paint‚Äîit‚Äôs a step toward a more personalized, efficient, and engaging HR experience.

Check out the 2H release home page video, with full details here on the new features, so you can empower your teams to get the most out of every interaction.

entry.title: Fiori SAML integration with Azure Entra ID
entry.content:
We are currently working on enabling the SAP application for external access. However, we have encountered an issue with SAML integration when using the external Fiori URL.

The integration functions works fine with the internal SAP URL, where all traffic routes through the VPC. For example, the internal URL is https://hostname:XXXXX/sap/saml2/sp/acs/210.

When using the external Fiori URL (for users not connected to our VPC), I encounter an issue post-authentication. The SAP page displays the message, "Our service is not available at the moment. Please try again later." I suspect the load balancer is not correctly transferring information to the SAP application server

Do we need open port externally for  SAP application server? how is the load balancer handles the SAML request? Appreciate your thoughts

URL, https://Fioridev.XX.XX.ondemand.com/sap/saml2/sp/acs/210

thanks

entry.title: How to programmatically set SAP BW Query Variables in BEx Analyzer via VBA (BEx 7.x / SAP GUI 7.6)
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I‚Äôm facing the following issue and have not been able to find an officially supported solution.

Problem Description:

I am using BEx Analyzer 7.x (SAP GUI 7.60, BW 7.x) to execute BW queries from Excel.

I need to programmatically set BW Query variables before running or refreshing a workbook.

The workbook is opened either through:

BEx Analyzer ‚Üí Open Workbook ‚Üí Roles ‚Üí ‚ÄúStandard Price: Creation‚Äù, or through a VBA call: application.run ‚ÄúBExAnalyzer.xla!xBEXapi.OpenWorkbook‚Äù, "technical_workbook_name"

Immediately after opening, the Variable Screen appears, and only after manually entering the parameters, the BEx Analyzer workbook (‚ÄúStandard Price List‚Äù) is generated.

Normally, the user fills in the Variable Screen manually.

I need to automatically set several BW Query variables using a VBA macro, either:

  • before the Variable Screen appears, or
  • by programmatically filling in the Variable Screen.

However, I cannot find a reliable or documented way to set variables via VBA.

Question:

What is the correct and officially supported way to programmatically set BW Query variables in BEx Analyzer 7.x using VBA?

Any clarification on:

  • which COM/OCX interfaces support variable assignment,
  • whether it is possible to pass variable values before the Variable Screen is triggered,
  • whether the Variable Screen can be filled programmatically,
  • how the variables structure (Range/array) should look,
  • and where to find documentation for SetVariables, AddVariables, VariableTable, and ExcelInterface

would be greatly appreciated.

P.S.

I am just starting with SAP BEx automation.

I found the technical names of variables through Variable Screen settings and Query Designer. Tracing is limited due to role restrictions.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Re: Customize /SCWM/TU transaction with a button on Application Toolbar
entry.content:
Thanks for sharing!

I realize this is an old post (2021) but in 2025 this was brought to my attention by a enthused functional consultants and I suspect others would find it as well and get excited. To be clear, what is described here is an implicit enhancement. This is just one step above the core modification (i.e. when you go in and just brutally change standard SAP code). 

If you're trying to follow Clean Core approach (as you should), then this solution would be "dirty core". This will not be supported by SAP and could cause long-term maintenance and upgrade problems. Make sure to consider very carefully if this is worth it. You've been warned. üôÇ

entry.title: BiWhy ‚Äì Sessions with New Features and Charts Demo
entry.content:
Disclaimer:

BiWhy is available again for FREE to everyone on biwhy.net

 

Sessions do not necessarily reflect concurrency, as they may be stale or inactive. Because of that, new functionality was added to analyze only new users/sessions separately.

BOBJ session overview, analysis, and administration:

  • Overview and analysis:
    • Session/User chart: the lines should run in parallel, ideally close to one another. Divergence usually indicates a problem.
    • Summary Table ‚Äì sessions aggregated by User / Authentication / Client.
      • Simultaneous Sessions ‚Äì high numbers are a sign of a session leak.
      • Unique Sessions ‚Äì how frequently a user logged in with a given method.
      • Max and Avg Duration ‚Äì high values indicate that sessions are not being closed, either explicitly or by timeout, or that there is real activity on those sessions.
    • Detailed Table ‚Äì shows details for each session.
    • Only new users/sessions per minute (configurable).The chart is also available for any BiWhy table.
  • Bucket analysis (here session duration) shows that most sessions last about 60 minutes. This indicates that they are being terminated by timeout, meaning users either do not close reports or explicit session termination on tab/browser close is not working. It also means that most of the sessions we see are idle.
  • The duration line chart visualizes the 60-minute pattern (timeout).
  • Duration Gantt view ‚Äì session dynamics.

 

  • Admin Page:
    • Analysis: It allows you to see live users and sessions in the system, similar to the CMC functionality, but with all analytical features available in BiWhy tables and charts.
    • Administration: It allows you to cancel selected users/sessions. Unlike in the CMC, you can do this in bulk, which is particularly useful when you have a large number of unwanted sessions. For example, VTO scripts often generate test users but fail to clean them up. Instead of waiting for timeouts or restarting the system (which may not be possible if a non-VTO script is generating sessions in a PROD environment), you can simply terminate all of them directly from BiWhy.

You can also see days-old stale sessions that somehow survive system restarts and are not visible in the CMC. They appear to be harmless, but for cleanup purposes, it is a good idea to cancel them as well.

Screenshots:

Session/User chart: the lines should run in parallel, ideally close to one another. Divergence usually indicates a problem that causes a session leak.

Detailed Table ‚Äì shows details for each session.

Summary Table ‚Äì sessions aggregated by User / Authentication / Client.

  • Simultaneous Sessions ‚Äì high numbers are a sign of a session leak.
  • Unique Sessions ‚Äì how frequently a user logged in with a given method.
  • Max and Avg Duration ‚Äì high values indicate that sessions are not being closed, either explicitly or by timeout, or that there is real activity on those sessions.

 

Only new users/sessions per minute (configurable).

The chart is also available for any BiWhy table.

Bucket analysis (here session duration) shows that most sessions last about 60 minutes. This indicates that they are being terminated by timeout, meaning users either do not close reports or explicit session termination on tab/browser close is not working. It also means that most of the sessions we see are idle.

The duration line chart visualizes the 60-minute pattern (timeout).

 

Duration Gantt view ‚Äì session dynamics.

 

Admin Page. Analysis & Administration.

entry.title: When using XCO I18N APIs I obtain the error message "Data element ... does not exist .."
entry.content:
Hello,
I'm testing the XCO Library in an S/4HANA 2022 on premise system and the I18N APIs (and also the XCO Query APIs) only consider as visible the customer objects released with a Contract C1:

If the data element is not release I obtain the error:
Data element ZDE_XCO_TEST_01 does not exist in active version.

        DATA(lo_text_attribute) = xco_cp_data_element=>text_attribute.

        DATA(lo_language) = xco_cp=>language( 'P' ).

        DATA(lo_text_heading) = lo_text_attribute->heading_field_label->create_text(  xco_cp=>string( 'ID' ) ).
        DATA(lo_text_long) = lo_text_attribute->long_field_label->create_text(  xco_cp=>string( 'Identificador' ) ).
        DATA(lo_text_medium) = lo_text_attribute->medium_field_label->create_text(  xco_cp=>string( 'Identificador' ) ).
        DATA(lo_text_short) = lo_text_attribute->short_field_label->create_text(  xco_cp=>string( 'Identif.' ) ).

        DATA(lo_target) = xco_cp_i18n=>target->data_element->object( iv_name = 'ZDE_XCO_TEST_01' ).

        DATA(lo_transport_request) = xco_cp_cts=>transport->for( iv_transport = 'DEVK973218' ).

        " Set the translation.
        lo_target->set_translation(
          it_texts           = VALUE #( ( lo_text_heading ) ( lo_text_long ) ( lo_text_medium ) ( lo_text_short ) )
          io_language        = lo_language
          io_change_scenario = lo_transport_request
        ).


The documentation says:

The entry point for retrieving a collection of objects from the ABAP Repository is XCO_CP_ABAP_REPOSITORY=>OBJECTS. Note that independently of any filters, the visible ABAP Repository objects are those which either have been explicitly released by SAP or which belong to customer software components. 

Does anyone know why the XCO requires the object to be released?

entry.title: Re: Validation and set creation
entry.content:
Dear @Andrea_Gr,

How can we define a new custom message for validation rules?

Answer:

  1. Open Fiori app ‚ÄúManage Substitution/Validation Rules‚Äù
  2. Open an existing Validation rule or create a new one.
  3. In General Information:
    • Set Control Level = Error or Warning.
    • Click value help on the Message field.
  4. In the popup:
    • Message ID/number
    • Short text (what user will see)
    • Severity (error/warning)
    • Choose Create
    • Enter:
    • Save.
  5. Back in the rule, select this new message in Message.

Now this custom text will appear when the validation fails.

More details below:

https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/#/detail/Apps('F4406')/S35

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/e6175604fc874bfe84aa14d2f9ae1fbd/5c8c2825535f4e3aa9b7f716a0085221.html

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/a376cd9ea00d476b96f18dea1247e6a5/ac7785b7870344a8998c8492c0cd5c3d.html

How can we implement a validation: Posting Date must not be greater than Acquisition Date?

Answer:

  1. In the same app Manage Substitution/Validation Rules click Create Rule.
  2. Choose:
    • Business Context (e.g. Journal Entry Item / asset-related context).
    • Rule Type = Validation Rule.
  3. In General Information:
    • Set Control Level = Error.
    • Assign the custom message from point 1.
  4. (Optional) In Precondition, restrict where it runs (company code, doc type, etc.).
  5. In the Validation section, add a condition:
    • Field: Posting Date
    • Operator: Less than or equal to (<=)
    • Value/Field: Acquisition Date

If Posting Date > Acquisition Date -> rule fails -> error message is shown.

       6. Save and Activate the rule.

How can we define Sets (dynamic value lists) and use them in validation rules?

Answer:

  1. Open Manage Substitution/Validation Rules
  2. In any rule (Precondition or Validation), add a new condition line.
  3. Choose a field (e.g. Document Type, Company Code).
  4. Choose operator IN / NOT IN.
  5. Click value help on the Value field.
  6. In the popup:
    • Set ID (e.g. Z_DOC_TYPES_INV)
    • Description
    • Values
    • Switch to Set / Set ID view.
    • Choose Create (new set).
    • Enter:
    • Save.
  7. Back in the condition:
    • Select your Set ID as the value.

More details below from SAP Community and SAP Note:

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/how-to-extend-a-custom-field-and-derive-the-value-using-the-manage/ba-p/13529638

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-q-a/how-to-create-sets-for-validation-in-s4-hana-cloud/qaq-p/12696426

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3583820

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: SAP Digital Manufacturing, Manual Setup of OEE with hierarchy.
entry.content:
Currently we are setting up Demos for OEE calculation, this is how far we got:

-Integrating Workcenters and Resources
-Setting up OEE Configuration with Reason Codes for Resources
-Changing Resource Status
-Calculating/Visualizing the OEE based on the availability for a Resource

However with a hierarchical Workcenter Structure in Mind...
1. Level: Production Line A
2. Level                        Line A - Cell A
2. Level                        Line A - Cell B
2. Level                        Line A - Cell C
..it seems like the OEE Configuration is much more complex and not intuitive. 

What we want to achive is to be able to aggregate the Cells, which produce in sequence by Resource Status to the Production Line. Meaning if one Cell is down, the whole line is down. 

However currently we dont see any possible way to integrate or manually create parent/child relationships at Workcenter oder Resource level, and also in the OEE Hierarchy Section of Manage Workcenters we are unable to add any hierarchy since the "Add" button never suggests something to add. 

Is this feature currently disabled?

In the meantime we will try to archieve our use case manually by creating dummy resources that represent the overall production line status.

It would be really helpful to have a blog post regarding the OEE Hierarchy.

entry.title: Print Form Services Credential Migration: We‚Äôre Live and Auto-Provisioning!
entry.content:
Dear customers and partners,

As a sequel to my previous blog announcing this migration here: Simplifying Print Form Services Credentialling - SAP Community

We‚Äôre pleased to announce that our migration of credentials for Print Form Services (PFS) is now fully complete. From this point forward, new PFS credentials will be automatically provisioned ‚Äî you no longer need to request or wait for manual issuance.

What this means for you

  • Seamless credential issuance: New accounts or services will receive PFS credentials automatically.

  • Minimal disruptions: All existing credentials remain valid and unaffected by the migration cut-over.

  • Improved stability and management: The fresh infrastructure delivers higher reliability and simplified administration.

Thank you!
We want to extend our heartfelt thanks to all of our customers and partners for your patience and support during this migration. Your cooperation made it possible for us to deliver this transition with minimal disruption and to enhance our services behind the scenes.

If you have any questions, notice any issues, or need assistance with your PFS credentials, please reach out to our support team and we‚Äôll be glad to help. Thank you for your partnership and for continuing to trust us.

entry.title: Breakdown analysis for equipment with no start-up date in cloud public
entry.content:
Hello all...

I found that executing the Technical object breakdowns App in S4/Hana public cloud 2508 there are no results when the equipment start-up date is not filled up, also with multiple notifications in differente times. At soon as I put a date in that field in the equipment master data record I can see the results. According to the documentation I found, the report should consider the second notification as the start date of the report when the equipment start-up date is blank. I found the note 3198903 (Notifications not appearing in app "Technical Object Breakdowns" despite having Breakdown checkbox set - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition) and it explains the same. Is there something to configure or to set up to be able to get the analysis without that info? I appreciate any help in this matter.

Thank you,

Javier G√≥mez

entry.title: Drive more Business Value out of your SAP Public Cloud Solution Subscriptions.
entry.content:
If you are an SAP Public Cloud customer running solutions like SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, SAP SuccessFactors, SAP Ariba, etc., or you are a new SAP Business Suite customer running public cloud packages, I want to make you aware of a great capability included in SAP for Me to help drive more business value out of your SAP subscription.

SAP for Me includes the Customer Insights Dashboard. This tool analyzes the history of your support data, product portfolio, renewals, support contracts, system landscape, cases, and more. Within this dashboard, there is a great section that shows Cloud Functional Usage. In the following blogs below from my SAP colleague Swetlana, you can learn more about how to use this Cloud Functional Usage section in detail. I advise you to review them before you continue so you can follow the example that I will present shortly.

Functional Usage for your Public Cloud Products in Customer Insights reporting in SAP for Me

Functional Usage - Value Drivers and Peer Group Comparison

SAP for Me ‚Äì Customer Insights Dashboard - Cloud Functional Usage

In this blog, I want to use the Cloud Functional Usage Report included in SAP for Me to give you a couple of recommendations to increase your business value from your SAP Public Cloud Subscription by focusing on the Value Drivers and relevant industry peer groups when you run different SAP Public Cloud Applications‚Äîin other words, to bring business value to your entire public cloud landscape.

In the following example below, imagine you are a live SAP customer with a public cloud landscape including subscriptions for: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, SAP SuccessFactors, SAP Business Data Cloud (‚ÄúSAP BDC‚Äù including Analytic Cloud and SAP Datasphere), and SAP BTP, or you may be a new SAP Business Suite Public Cloud customer as I discussed before.

Example - Live SAP customer with a public cloud landscape

In this example, you have already followed some of the recommendations provided in my last blog  for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, but now want to focus on increasing business value for the entire public cloud landscape.

First, you need to go to SAP for Me and select the Cloud Functional Usage Report. I suggest you quickly review the Usage History to view your solution capabilities, but I recommend adding the view by Product to make it simpler to identify in your landscape.

SAP for Me ‚Äì Customer Insights Dashboard - Cloud Functional Usage ‚Äì Usage History

With the product view, now you can look at the solution capabilities in your different SAP Product Subscriptions.

Cloud Functional Usage ‚Äì Usage History view by Product

Per Swetlana‚Äôs previous blog explanations, you know that this view shows your current usage by solution capability for each specific subscribed product.

Now that you are looking at your usage, you can see the business impact, so you can now select the ‚ÄúBusiness Value‚Äù tab to focus on the value drivers and relevant industry peer groups. Here, I also recommend that you view the graphic by product.

SAP for Me ‚Äì Customer Insights Dashboard - Cloud Functional Usage ‚Äì Business Value

By doing so, you can now see the top 10 value drivers based on the most used solution capabilities in your landscape.

Cloud Functional Usage ‚Äì Business Value ‚Äì view by Product

You now have a great option to render this graphic by specific value driver(s), by product(s), or by both, which will give you plenty of flexibility to look at business outcomes. Let‚Äôs imagine you want to impact the reduction of finance costs in your organization to make your finance team more productive and cost-effective. You can select that value driver and look at your current usage in your company.

Cloud Functional Usage ‚Äì Business Value ‚Äì filtered by Value Driver ‚ÄúReduce finance cost‚Äù

You can see here that this value driver is impacted by a couple of products including: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (Finance), SAP Analytics Cloud (SAP BDC), and Cash & Treasury Add-on (Finance).

You also see that there are plenty of solution capabilities not used (in gray), which you can evaluate to see if you can start using them to help drive more business value. However, what makes this report really useful is that you can look at your usage intensity or lack of usage by comparing it with your relevant industry peer group. This means you can benchmark your usage with your industry peer group to gain some insights on what other SAP customers are doing.

Cloud Functional Usage ‚Äì Business Value ‚Äì selected by non-used solution capabilities in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

In the above example, I selected the 30 non-used solution capabilities in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, as I really want to impact the reduction of financial cost. When doing this, I see that my industry peer group is highly using 9 out of the 30 capabilities, moderately using 4 out of the 30 capabilities, and low using 17 out of the 30 capabilities.

So this helps you benchmark your usage with your industry peer group. Here it will make sense to see what are those 9 capabilities that I can evaluate to implement to help drive more business value. So, if I select the 9 capabilities in the industry footprint graph, I can now see the details below.

Cloud Functional Usage ‚Äì Business Value ‚Äì selected by highly used solution capabilities in relevant industry peer group in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

If I then select the solution capability ‚ÄúFinancial Reporting,‚Äù I get an overview of the functionality on how it contributes to the value driver. I also get additional information, such as the Fiori apps that I can start using or activate to benefit from this functionality.

Solution Capability ‚Äì Financial Reporting

I can then click on all 33 relevant Fiori apps and go to the SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library to see the apps.

SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library filtered by Solution Capability ‚Äì Financial Reporting

From there, I can get all information from the app, such as product information and implementation, and I can then check directly in my system landscape.

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition ‚Äì Looking at Fiori App ‚ÄúDisplay Cash Flow ‚Äì Indirect Method‚Äù

I can then go back and look at the other components‚Äîlike the Cash & Treasury Add-on‚Äîand compare them with the relevant industry peer group that I potentially should be considering. I see that the Financial Risk Management (which I don‚Äôt use) solution capability has a moderate usage among relevant industry peers, so I should evaluate its applicability.

Cloud Functional Usage ‚Äì Business Value ‚Äì selected by non-used solution capabilities in Cash & Treasury Add-on

I can click again on the solution capability to look at impacts, view the Fiori Application Library, and review the apps in my system as I did before.

Solution Capability ‚Äì Financial Risk Management

This time, instead of looking at each app, I will click on the SAP Fiori Apps grouped by end user role ‚ÄúTreasury Risk Manager‚Äù to see the overall business role in the SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library.

SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library filtered by Solution Capability ‚Äì Financial Risk Management ‚Äì Treasury Risk Manager Role

You could also look at this using a list view or try the new list view that has significantly improved how information is rendered.

SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library New List View filtered by Solution Capability ‚Äì Financial Risk Management

From here, you can go to your system landscape and then look to include the SAP business role you are not using, ‚ÄúTreasury Risk Manager.‚Äù

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition ‚Äì Activating ‚ÄúTreasury Risk Manager Role‚Äù

Now, let's take a look at SAP SuccessFactors. I go back to the Cloud Functional Usage Report, but this time I will filter by Product.

Cloud Functional Usage ‚Äì Business Value ‚Äì filtered by Product ‚ÄúSAP SuccessFactors‚Äù

Here you can now see the Top 10 value drivers for SAP SuccessFactors. Of course, you can select specific components to evaluate specific areas of improvement.

If I focus now only on SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central, I can see that there are 4 solution capabilities I am not using which have a high impact on many value drivers.

Cloud Functional Usage ‚Äì Business Value ‚Äì selected by non-used solution capabilities in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central

If I am very conservative and only focus on the high usage in the relevant industry peer group, I see that I could impact many value drivers by focusing on ‚ÄúPosition Management‚Äù solution capability.

Cloud Functional Usage ‚Äì Business Value ‚Äì selected by highly used solution capability in relevant industry peer group in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central

Like in the other example, I can click on the solution capability to review the details.

Solution Capability ‚Äì Position Management

And then go to SAP SuccessFactors to activate the solution capability.

SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central ‚Äì Activating Position Management

And start using it in your system.

SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central ‚Äì Using Position Management

I could continue the exploration to the SAP BDC components (SAP Analytics Cloud & SAP Datasphere), see below and run another cycle as the ones I presented above.

Cloud Functional Usage ‚Äì Business Value ‚Äì filtered by Product ‚ÄúSAP BDC ‚Äì SAP Analytics Cloud & SAP Datasphere‚Äù

I hope this Cloud Functional Usage information included in SAP for ME provides you with some ideas for your new projects, new business rollouts, or new business requirements for your entire public cloud landscape. Keep in mind that solution capabilities are expanding from traditional functional scope to also include SAP Business AI, so SAP will continue to add more in this area. Remember, this is not the only tool that can be used; SAP has other tools such as SAP Signavio, SAP WalkMe, SAP LeanIX, and SAP Cloud ALM that can be used in tandem to help drive more business value from your SAP subscription. I encourage you to discuss these points with your SAP Customer Success Manager, SAP Account Executive, or SAP Partner. They may be able to provide you with additional recommendations and guidance.

Your insights and opinions are valuable, so please don't hesitate to contribute by commenting on this blog.

Follow us via @SAP and #S4HANA or follow @Marco_Valencia (SAP Business Suite Customer Success Management).

entry.title: Re: Onboarding 1.0 Decommissioning Procedure & FAQ
entry.content:
I also want to call out an excellent question that came up this week in discussions with a customer, and one I wanted to note here as well in a comment. Please see my revised blog above.

What happens to my E-Verify Cases through Onboarding 1.0?

While your E-Verify Cases will no longer be accessible through the Onboarding 1.0 interface after decommissioning, you can still export the "E-Verify Summary Form" to have a record of the E-Verify Cases created during Onboarding 1.0's tenure. This Form should be part of your Document Export and Retention functions as part of decommissioning, listed above.

What happens to any outstanding or open E-Verify Cases through Onboarding 1.0, when the product is decommissioned?

There may be some circumstances where there are E-Verify Cases that are still open during Onboarding 1.0's decommissioning and afterwards, and that cannot be acted on as they are pending either government (DHS, SSA, or both) action. For these outstanding E-Verify Cases, please generate a Report within Onboarding 1.0 for these Cases. SAP SuccessFactors, as your E-Verify Web Service Provider, can continue to provide updates to you through a Customer Support Case.

We anticipate this should be a rare situation in the event customers have successfully been able to reduce and migrate their E-Verify activity over to Onboarding or another solution prior to the decommissioning.

entry.title: PLR 2025 - Corre√ß√µes retroativas de imposto
entry.content:
Ol√° pessoal, 

Acabamos de lan√ßar uma solu√ß√£o importante para lidar com o desafio tribut√°rio da Participa√ß√£o nos Lucros e Resultados (PLR) de 2025, permitindo que a folha de pagamento corrija o pagamento de imposto ap√≥s a publica√ß√£o tardia da tabela oficial de impostos pelo Governo Brasileiro. 

Desafio de 2025 

A publica√ß√£o tardia da tabela oficial de impostos do PLR para 2025 trouxe as seguintes consequ√™ncias: 

  • Processamento com Tabela Anterior: Empresas utilizaram a tabela do ano anterior, gerando um c√°lculo de imposto equivocado 
  • Publica√ß√£o Retroativa: A nova tabela foi publicada com validade retroativa 
  • Impacto nos Funcion√°rios: Colaboradores pagaram mais impostos do que o devido 
  • Autoriza√ß√£o Governamental: Governo autorizou empresas a reembolsarem os valores pagos em excesso 

Nossa Solu√ß√£o 

Desenvolvemos uma solu√ß√£o que identifica e corrige retroativamente os impostos sobre PLR pagos em excesso durante 2025. O sistema utiliza novas rubricas para calcular as diferen√ßas e processar os reembolsos devidos aos colaboradores, garantindo conformidade com as autoriza√ß√µes governamentais. 

A solu√ß√£o est√° dispon√≠vel atrav√©s das seguintes SAP Notes: 

  • 3672102 - Retroactive PLR Tax Corrections: Creation of New Wage Types 
  • 3669244 - BRIR - Retroactive PLR Tax Corrections  for 2025
  • 3681233 - eSocial - S-1010 - Adjustments for /IOP and /ROP wage types 

Novas Rubricas 

O sistema introduz tr√™s novas rubricas que trabalham em conjunto: 

  • /IRP - Indicador reembolso PLR: Rubrica adicionada manualmente no infotipo 0015 ‚Äì Pagamento complementar para acionar o c√°lculo retroativo 
  • /IOP - IRRF PLR desc. em excesso: Indica o valor pago em excesso 
  • /ROP - Reembolso IRRF sobre PLR: Reembolso do valor pago em excesso 

Como Funciona 

Acionamento Manual: Para colaboradores que n√£o receber√£o mais pagamentos de PLR em 2025 o acionamento √© manual 

  • Adicione a rubrica /IRP ao √∫ltimo per√≠odo pagamento incorreto no infotipo 0015 
  • Sistema calcular√° automaticamente os valores em excesso 
  • Reembolso ser√° processado na pr√≥xima folha 

Ajuste Autom√°tico: Para funcion√°rios com pagamentos futuros de PLR no ano de 2025, o ajuste √© autom√°tico 

  • Nenhuma a√ß√£o manual necess√°ria 
  • Sistema ajusta automaticamente no pr√≥ximo pagamento de PLR 
  • Ambas as rubricas, /IOP e /ROP, aparecem no mesmo per√≠odo se a compensa√ß√£o for insuficiente 

Transfer√™ncia e PLR em Empresas Anteriores: Para empregados transferidos entre empresas 

  • Adicione /IRP ao √∫ltimo pagamento de PLR de cada empresa afetada 
  • Trate a empresa atual da mesma forma que nos cen√°rios acima 
  • O dinheiro pago em excesso de todos os PLRs calculados de forma incorreta ser√£o reembolsados no pr√≥ximo pagamento 

Considera√ß√µes Importantes 

  • Aplica√ß√£o Espec√≠fica para 2025: Esta solu√ß√£o foi desenvolvida especificamente para lidar com o atraso da tabela de PLR de 2025 
  • C√°lculo Anual: Impostos de PLR s√£o calculados anualmente, considerando todos os pagamentos do ano 
  • Uso Inteligente do Gatilho: Adicione /IRP apenas quando n√£o houver mais pagamentos de PLR esperados 

Com essas atualiza√ß√µes, voc√™ garantir√° que seus sistemas estejam em conformidade com as exig√™ncias governamentais, promovendo efici√™ncia e tratamento justo aos funcion√°rios afetados pela situa√ß√£o excepcional de 2025. 

Gostou desse post? 

D√™ um Like e compartilhe o conte√∫do com seus colegas. 

Fiquem √† vontade para deixar um feedback, coment√°rio ou pergunta sobre este Blog post no espa√ßo abaixo. E n√£o esque√ßam de seguir a tag HCM Payroll Brazil na SAP Community para ficarem ligados nas √∫ltimas not√≠cias. 

Um abra√ßo, 
Ramiro dos Santos Manoel 
Time de HCM Brasil

entry.title: Re: Transporting Deleted Teams from Test to Production in...
entry.content:
@OmPan 

Unfortunately, SAC transport mechanisms don't handle deletions.

The transport process in SAP Analytics Cloud is like this, on a tenant when we create or update objects we can create an export and collect these objects and when we import them they get created or updated in the target tenant. The process only creates or updates objects, and there is no way to capture a deleted object in a transport. 

Unlike ABAP transports, which capture objects marked for deletion and can replicate object deletions across systems, SAC transports are additive only. 

What this means for you: The Teams you deleted in Test won't automatically be removed in Production through a transport. You'll need to delete them separately in Production.

Recommended approach for future housekeeping: Since you're dealing with multiple Teams, I'd suggest using the SAC User & Team Provisioning (SCIM) API to delete the teams programmatically across tenants. 

Refer this blog for detailed information on using the API, https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-analytics-cloud-user-and-team-provisioning-api-hands-on-video-tutorials/ba-p/13510017

entry.title: Rehire process with ONB 2.0 and mini EC
entry.content:
Hi,

Has anyone implemented ONB 2.0 with mini EC for rehire process? As per SAP documentation, rehire process is not supported with mini EC. I am looking experiences from projects that have successfully gone live for Rehire process with ONB 2.0+mini EC.

We are thinking of treating rehire as a new hire in ONB but in this case, we are having below roadblocks:

1. We are planning to store external HRIS employee number in Person ID external field. However, every rehire [for that matter hire as well] will have a new user ID created [as per SF number range], leading a situation wherein Person ID external [External HRIS Employee Number] and User ID both being different. This wouldn't impact us for ONB, RCM scope but as we expand the scope in the future with talent modules, this will create some challenges [e.g. Performance history, learning history will be on two different user IDs, etc.].

2.  Because ONB rehire match functionality cannot be used with mini-EC, we are unable to meet business requirements around bringing past employment data into ONB or RCM such as Rehire eligibility. We are planning to build a new interface either with external HRIS application or SF mini EC [we will have to bring termination history] to bring rehire check value [and other attributes] into RCM.

Thanks in advance!

Regards,

Amol

entry.title: How Difficult Is the SAP ERP Consultant Role Today?

Hello everyone,

From my own experience in SAP FICO, the job definitely requires a mix of technical skills, business understanding, and continuous learning ‚Äî especially with S/4HANA, Fiori, and new cloud-related changes. It‚Äôs a demanding role, but also one that brings a lot of reward and growth.

I‚Äôd like to hear your thoughts:

  • What aspects of SAP consulting do you find the most challenging?
  • In your view, is the role becoming more difficult with newer SAP technologies, or are tools actually making things easier?

  • What advice would you give to someone starting their SAP journey?

    Looking forward to hearing different perspectives from the community.

Please note that registration is now closed, as of November 15, 12:00 pm TRT, due to reaching the registration limit. All registrations received after the initial limit of 25 will be considered for the waiting list. A confirmation email will be sent to those who have successfully registered before the event.

This SAP CodeJam event focuses on SAP HANA Cloud for AI Applications, covering topics such as machine learning, Vectors, and Knowledge Graphs. You don't need to have any background in the topic, but you should have a lot of curiosity and some basic programming skills!

This is a free in-person event and is planned for Saturday, December 13, in Istanbul, T√ºrkiye üáπüá∑ from 10:00 to 16:00 TRT (UTC+3). The event's language and content will be in English. 

The event is being hosted by Sovos at
√ñz sokak No: 19/10 üòß 45 Gold Plaza, Altay√ße≈üme,
34843 Maltepe/ƒ∞stanbul

Please note that space is limited, as we can only accommodate 25 attendees.

By the end of the session, you‚Äôll have built examples that demonstrate how SAP HANA Cloud can serve as a versatile back-end for modern Artificial Intelligence applications:

  • Leverage the SAP HANA Vector Engine for high‚Äëdimensional embeddings‚Äîbuilding a vector store that supports semantic similarity search.
  • Implement Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)  to enrich generative AI outputs with precise, up-to-date data.
  • Model and Query a Knowledge Graph inside SAP HANA using RDF triples to extract semantic relationships.
  • Integrate HANA with LangChain to build AI apps that orchestrate prompt workflows, execute database statements, and navigate knowledge graphs‚Äîall directly from Python, in this case.

entry.title: Re: Doubt Regarding accessibility of Company ID

Hello @sanskruti_pawar671 ,
The Company ID represents your SF BizX instance in a specific data center. The value you are seeing under "Show Version Information" is the correct ID:

  • 2655655 - How to find the SAP SuccessFactors Company ID

For the authentication, you must use the URL for the Data Center where your instance is:

  • 2089448 - SuccessFactors Data Center Name, Location, URL, Domain Name, Mail Server details, SFTP details and Outbound IP addresses

If you are using Basic Authentication to access the SF instance, you will receive this error message if you are typing the CompanyID when using a different DC URL.

entry.title: Sydney Stammtisch Recap Nov '25 (Mastering SAP vs. Tech Ed On Tour)
entry.content:
Usually our #Sydney #Stammtisch events are planned a few weeks in advance (I plan ahead to a fault) but this one ended up being somewhat impromptu.  We had what I thought was our last event of 2025 a couple of weeks ago.  As Mastering SAP often organise great social events as part of their conference (this year a Tech Ed On Tour Event no less) I thought that we shouldn't 'compete' with whatever they had planned.  Well, it turned out that there wasn't an official social event in the calendar so when@AnnePetteroe reached out to us we were already open to the idea of holding a (possibly unprecedented) fifth Stammtisch of 2025.

It was a bit of a scramble but @jeff_t managed to line up a great venue - Sydney Pumphouse - which was very close to the conference venue and close to where most visitors were staying.  We had a great crowd of men & women, both on the younger side and on the slightly less young side.  We had native born Australians alongside people from pretty much every continent (ish).  We had people with blue beards, and people without blue beards (I would say that the latter were in the majority).

Debra from Mastering used the 5mins that she had free on the eve of the conference to come and meet everyone, which was awesome.

As we get more and more people attending Stammtisch my photos seem to do less and less justice to the event.  It was quite dark inside and so I mainly grabbed a few snaps on the terrace.  I thought there were at least 50 attendees but I saw @thomas_jung say on YouTube that there were '70-80' people there, and I wouldn't like to argue with Thomas!

Please feel free to add your own photos in the comments.

A real highlight was the three students who showed having seen @josh_bentley on You Tube shorts mentioning Stammtisch.  Tamer put in a call to someone at Mastering SAP to get them access to the conference somehow, which was just awesome of him. 

It was a great start to what turned out to be a great conference and I do wonder whether we should repeat the same format next year.  Tuesday night is a tough night to get locals out, and we missed many fly-ins because they were due to arrive too late or because their flights got delayed by strong winds.  We might have got more locals if we had given more notice. We could go for the end of Day 1 of the conference, but then there may be other events then (like the awesome RevTrac drinks).

What do you think?

Certainly no-one should be booking flights to Sydney for Mastering SAP Collaborate 2026 without checking with us first üòâ

Thanks so much to everyone who came!

entry.title: Quickly Deploy a Sample CAP Application to BTP
entry.content:
Prerequisites

Before you deploy your sample SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) app to SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), ensure you have the following in place:

  1. BTP Account (Trial or Paid)
    You‚Äôll need a BTP global account with a sub-account in the Cloud Foundry environment.

    • You can register for a free trial at the SAP website. BTP Trial

  2. Development Environment: SAP Business Application Studio or VS Code alternative + CLI tools & MBT 

    • If using Business Application Studio, follow SAP‚Äôs onboarding tutorial: ‚ÄúSet Up SAP Business Application Studio for Development‚Äù. Setup Business Application Studio

    • Otherwise you may use VS Code (or another IDE) with the following command-line tools:

      • Cloud Foundry CLI (cf CLI) ‚Äì Install instructions here: CF CLI

      • Cloud MTA Build Tool (mbt) ‚Äì Install and usage information here: MBT

    • Make sure you‚Äôve configured your CLI to target your BTP subaccount/space (cf api, cf login, cf target). CLI API & Login

  3. HANA DB Instance (or Trial) for your DB
    Your CAP app will typically require a database backend.

    • Get started with the HANA Cloud trial using this tutorial:  HANA Trial

After completing all the prerequisites we can start build the application

Start a Terminal in you IDE of choice

generate the project

cds init bookshop --add sample

Add hana, mta, xsuaa and workzone

cds add hana,mta,xsuaa,workzone --for production

run npm install in all the applications, the sample bookshop has 2 Fiori Elements applications that we'll need to run npm i in their folder as well as in the project folder

cd app/admin-books
npm i
cd ../browse
npm i
cd ../..
npm i

now we can build the project

mbt build

if all goes well then we'll get an mtar file inside the mta_archive folder

before deploying we'll need to make sure that we're logged into cloud foundry

cf login

now we deploy

cf deploy mta_archives/*.mtar

and that is it you should now have a CAP service and 2 fiori elements applications deployed on BTP.

You can then create an instance of Work Zone and surface the application through it or build applications that use the cap application as its backend (This is what I intend to do in upcoming blogs)

entry.title: Identity Access Governance - Understanding Authorization Policies
entry.content:
We have often seen business scenarios where requirement is to restrict the Access/Role search in IAG  Access Request to specific list of roles for defined set of users. For e.g. Users in country/company code X should only see the roles for country/company code X in the Access request form to request.

In GRC Access Controls, we achieve this requirement from traditional authorizations/roles concept and role search functionality

IAG offers the concept of defining Authorization Policies to achieve this goal

 

Overview

Authorization policies determine which roles, applications, or business roles end users can search and request in the Access Request application. Administrators can configure these policies in the Authorization Policy app to control search visibility and request capability

 

Authorizations for Access Request

When performing a role search in the Access Request app, results may be restricted based on authorization policies. Administrators define which Access objects, Business Roles, or Applications/Systems users can search and request.

 

Policy Types for Role Search

Access

  • Action: Request Access
  • Description: Allows assigned users to request access for all Access items defined by the authorization object attributes.
  • Authorization Object Attributes:
    • Name
    • Application
    • Application Type
    • Access Type
    • Business Process
    • Business Subprocess

Business Role

  • Action: Request Access
  • Description: Allows assigned users to request access for all Business Roles defined by the authorization object attributes.
  • Authorization Object Attributes:
    • Name
    • Business Process
    • Business Subprocess
    • Criticality

Application/System

  • Action: Request Access
  • Description: Allows assigned users to request access for all Applications/Systems defined by the authorization object attributes.
  • Authorization Object Attributes:
    • Application
    • Application Type

 

Application - Authorization Policy under Administration section

Flowchart

 

  1. Policy Set - Container of multiple policies of a specific Policy type (for e,g, Access/Access Risk/Business Role etc.). Users are assigned to Policy sets based on User attributes.
  2. Policies - Policies are maintained within policy set and can be activated/deactivated based on need. Each policy contains Authorizations which further contains
    1.   "Actions"  (for e,g, Request Access in policy set type Access and Business Role)
    2.  "Access/Business Roles" based on attributes.

 

Screenshots

 

Authorization Policy App

 

Creation of Policy Set

 

Creation of Policy

 

Configuration of Authorizations and Access/Business role based on attributes

 

Defining Access

 

Defining Users based on attributes

 

Conclusion

Once policy is activated, Access and Business roles will be filtered based on defined authorization policies.

Standard SAP documentation - Authorization Policies in Identity Access Governance

entry.title: Fixing IGS Connection Issues After SID Change in S/4HANA Migration
entry.content:
When migrating an SAP S/4HANA system and changing the System ID (SID), you might encounter issues with graphical charts in certain transactions. A common example is Transaction DB02, which shows database performance and space statistics.

After migration, executing DB02 may result in :  IGS not available (RC=1), Charts not available

Root Cause
The Internet Graphics Service (IGS) is responsible for rendering charts in SAP GUI. It communicates via an RFC destination named IGS_RFC_DEST. When the SID changes during migration, this RFC destination still points to the old SID, causing the connection to fail.

Symptoms

  • Charts in DB02 are missing.
  • RFC destination IGS_RFC_DEST fails the connection test.
  • Error message: IGS not available (RC=1).

Solution: Update RFC Destination
Step 1: Go to Transaction SM59

Navigate to RFC Destinations.
Search for IGS_RFC_DEST (Type: TCP/IP Connection).

Step 2: Test the Connection

Perform a Connection Test.
It will fail because the program name and gateway details are incorrect.

Step 3: Update the RFC Parameters
Modify the following fields:

  • Program Name: IGS.<SID> (Replace <SID> with your new system ID.)
  • Gateway Host: Set this to the CI (Central Instance) server host of the new SID.
  • Gateway Service: sapgw<nn> (Replace <nn> with the instance number of the CI.)

Step 4: Save and Test Again

Run the Connection Test. It should now succeed.

Step 5: Verify in DB02

Execute DB02 again. Charts should now be visible.

Additional Tips

  • After any SID change, review all RFC destinations in SM59.
  • Check other services like SAP Gateway and IGS to ensure they are running.
  • If you use load-balanced systems, verify the gateway host points to the correct application server.

entry.title: SAP AIDevCon 2025: A Day That Redefined AI Innovation
entry.content:
What an absolute triumph yesterday was! The SAP AIDevCon 2025 event on November 8th wasn't just another conference; it was a powerful convergence of ideas, talent, and technology that truly demonstrated the revolutionary potential of Business AI.

The air in the venue was charged with incredible energy and vibrancy. We saw over 50+ passionate participants from more than 26+ diverse corporates and 3 key Indian universities come together. The goal was simple but profound: to not just talk about AI, but to build it.

Igniting Innovation: The Hands-on Experience

The day kicked off with invaluable networking‚Äîthe kind that sparks future projects‚Äîfollowed by an inspiring keynote address from our VP, Head of APAC. This set the stage for the true excitement: the hands-on experience.

Our participants didn't just attend sessions; they became builders. They immersed themselves in cutting-edge SAP BTP AI services, specifically using:

  • SAP Build for powerful low-code process automation.

  • Document AI to intelligently process unstructured business documents.

  • Translation Hub to instantly break down language barriers in applications.

The highlight was the intensive hackathon. Our audience, a perfect blend of industry experts and bright university students, worked in fierce yet collaborative teams. The atmosphere was one of positive vibes and shared goals, where they had to train, exhibit, and deliver industry-ready prototypes.

Breakthrough Prototypes: Solving Real Problems

The solutions developed were not academic exercises‚Äîthey were direct answers to critical business challenges. The teams built phenomenal prototypes that showcased the speed and scale possible with SAP BTP AI, focusing on real-world impact:

  1. Dispute Management: Creating smart solutions to automate and accelerate complex financial and operational dispute resolution.

  2. Piracy Protection: Leveraging AI to build robust, automated systems for safeguarding digital assets and intellectual property.

  3. Wellbeing: Developing AI-driven applications to enhance employee and user well-being through proactive insights and personalised support.

This entire day was a masterclass in learning, teamwork, and execution, all driven by the powerful capabilities of SAP Business Technology Platform.

Gratitude for Our Ecosystem of Heroes

A monumental event like this is only possible because of a dedicated community. A huge and sincere thank you goes out to:

  • Our incredible mentors and volunteers whose guidance transformed ideas into working code.

  • All the brilliant participants for bringing their enthusiasm and skill.

  • The SAP Leadership for championing the vision of an AI-first future.

  • The unsung heroes in IT, Security, and Admin, and each and every hero behind the scenes, whose seamless work made the entire event feel effortless.

Super Energetic - SAP Community

Networking

SAP Build Sessions

Hands-On Sessions

Hackathon - Planning

SAP Document AI Sessions

Hackathon - Presentation

Hackathon - Presentation

Hackathon - Presentation by College Students

That's me!

Again that's me in action!

What's Next? A Teaser!

The energy and innovation we witnessed at SAP AIDevCon 2025 proved one thing: the appetite for building intelligent, transformative solutions is immense.

This event was a resounding success, and we're already hard at work planning something even bigger and better. Stay tuned, because we are preparing to launch the next, even more exciting, version of AIDevCon very soon!

Keep learning, keep building, and we look forward to welcoming you back to the innovation floor.

Ÿàÿ≠ÿØÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ®Ÿäÿπÿßÿ™ ŸàÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿàÿ≤Ÿäÿπ ŸáŸä "ÿßŸÑÿ®Ÿàÿßÿ®ÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ±ÿ≥ŸÖŸäÿ©" ÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿä ÿ™ÿ≥ÿ™ŸÇÿ®ŸÑ Ÿáÿ∞ÿß ÿßŸÑŸÇÿ±ÿßÿ±. ŸÉŸÑ ÿ∑ŸÑÿ® ÿ®Ÿäÿπÿå ŸÉŸÑ ÿπÿ±ÿ∂ ÿ≥ÿπÿ±ÿå ŸàŸÉŸÑ ŸàÿπÿØ ÿ®ÿ™ŸÇÿØŸäŸÖ ÿÆÿØŸÖÿ© ŸÑŸÑÿπŸÖŸäŸÑ Ÿäÿ®ÿØÿ£ ŸÖŸÜ ŸáŸÜÿß.

 

 ÿ™ÿÆÿ®ÿ± ÿßŸÑŸÖÿÆÿ≤ŸÜ ÿ®ŸÖÿß Ÿäÿ¨ÿ® ÿπŸÑŸäŸá ŸÅÿπŸÑŸá

ÿ∑ŸÑÿ® ÿßŸÑÿ®Ÿäÿπ ŸáŸà ŸÖÿ¨ÿ±ÿØ ÿ®ŸäÿßŸÜÿßÿ™ ŸÅŸä ÿßŸÑŸÜÿ∏ÿßŸÖ ÿ≠ÿ™Ÿâ Ÿäÿ∫ÿßÿØÿ± ÿßŸÑŸÖŸÜÿ™ÿ¨ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿÆÿ≤ŸÜ ŸÅÿπŸÑŸäŸãÿß. ŸàŸáŸÜÿß ŸäŸÉŸÖŸÜ ÿßŸÑÿßÿ™ÿµÿßŸÑ ÿßŸÑÿ£ŸàŸÑ. ŸÅŸä ÿßŸÑŸÑÿ≠ÿ∏ÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿä Ÿäÿ™ŸÖ ŸÅŸäŸáÿß ÿ•ŸÜÿ¥ÿßÿ° ÿ∑ŸÑÿ® ÿ®Ÿäÿπ ŸÅŸä Ÿàÿ≠ÿØÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ®Ÿäÿπÿßÿ™ ŸàÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿàÿ≤Ÿäÿπÿå ŸÅÿ•ŸÜŸáÿß ÿ™ÿ±ÿ≥ŸÑ ÿ±ÿ≥ÿßŸÑÿ© ŸÅŸàÿ±Ÿäÿ© ÿ•ŸÑŸâ ŸÅÿ±ŸäŸÇ ÿ•ÿØÿßÿ±ÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÑŸàÿ¨ÿ≥ÿ™Ÿäÿßÿ™ ŸàÿßŸÑŸÖÿÆÿßÿ≤ŸÜ (ÿ£Ÿä Ÿàÿ≠ÿØÿ™Ÿä ÿ•ÿØÿßÿ±ÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ¥ÿ™ÿ±Ÿäÿßÿ™ Ÿàÿ•ÿØÿßÿ±ÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÖÿÆÿßÿ≤ŸÜ) ÿ™ŸÇŸàŸÑ:

"ÿßŸÜÿ™ÿ®ŸáŸàÿß! ÿßÿ∞Ÿáÿ®Ÿàÿß ÿ•ŸÑŸâ ÿßŸÑÿ±ŸÅ ÿØ-3ÿå ÿ¨Ÿáÿ≤Ÿàÿß 30 ŸÉÿ±ÿ™ŸàŸÜÿ© ŸÖŸÜ ÿßŸÑŸÖŸÜÿ™ÿ¨ (ÿ≥)ÿå ŸÇŸàŸÖŸàÿß ÿ®ÿ™ÿ∫ŸÑŸäŸÅŸáÿßÿå Ÿàÿßÿ≥ÿ™ÿπÿØŸàÿß ŸÑÿ¥ÿ≠ŸÜŸáÿß ÿ•ŸÑŸâ ÿπŸÜŸàÿßŸÜ Ÿáÿ∞ÿß ÿßŸÑÿπŸÖŸäŸÑ."

ÿ®ÿØŸàŸÜ Ÿàÿ≠ÿØÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ®Ÿäÿπÿßÿ™ ŸàÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿàÿ≤Ÿäÿπ ÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿä ÿ™ÿπÿ∑Ÿä Ÿáÿ∞Ÿá ÿßŸÑÿ£ŸàÿßŸÖÿ±ÿå ÿ≥Ÿäÿ®ŸÇŸâ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿÆÿ≤ŸÜ ŸÖÿ¨ÿ±ÿØ ŸÖÿ®ŸÜŸâ ŸÉÿ®Ÿäÿ± ŸÖŸÑŸäÿ° ÿ®ÿßŸÑÿ®ÿ∂ÿßÿ¶ÿπ ÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿä ŸÑÿß ÿ™ÿπÿ±ŸÅ ÿ•ŸÑŸâ ÿ£ŸäŸÜ ÿ™ÿ∞Ÿáÿ®.

 

 ÿ™ÿ∂ŸÖŸÜ ÿ£ŸÜ ÿßŸÑÿ¥ÿ±ŸÉÿ© ÿ™ÿ™ÿ≠ÿµŸÑ ÿπŸÑŸâ ÿ£ŸÖŸàÿßŸÑŸáÿß

Ÿáÿ∞ÿß ŸáŸà ÿßŸÑÿßÿ™ÿµÿßŸÑ ÿßŸÑÿ´ÿßŸÜŸä ŸàÿßŸÑÿ£ŸáŸÖ. ÿ®ÿπÿØ ÿ£ŸÜ Ÿäÿ§ŸÉÿØ ŸÅÿ±ŸäŸÇ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿÆÿ≤ŸÜ ÿ£ŸÜ "ÿßŸÑÿ®ÿ∂ÿßÿπÿ© ŸÇÿØ ÿ™ŸÖ ÿ¥ÿ≠ŸÜŸáÿß"ÿå ÿ™ŸÑÿ™ŸÅÿ™ Ÿàÿ≠ÿØÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ®Ÿäÿπÿßÿ™ ŸàÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿàÿ≤Ÿäÿπ ŸÅŸàÿ±Ÿãÿß Ÿàÿ™ÿ±ÿ≥ŸÑ ÿ±ÿ≥ÿßŸÑÿ© ÿ•ŸÑŸâ ŸÅÿ±ŸäŸÇ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿßŸÑŸäÿ©. Ÿáÿ∞Ÿá ÿßŸÑÿ±ÿ≥ÿßŸÑÿ© ŸáŸä ÿßŸÑŸÅÿßÿ™Ÿàÿ±ÿ©. ŸàÿßŸÑÿ±ÿ≥ÿßŸÑÿ© ÿ™ŸÇŸàŸÑ:

"ŸÖÿ±ÿ≠ÿ®Ÿãÿß Ÿäÿß ŸÅÿ±ŸäŸÇ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿßŸÑŸäÿ©! ŸÑŸÇÿØ ÿ®ÿπŸÜÿß ÿ®ÿ∂ÿßÿπÿ© ÿ®ŸÇŸäŸÖÿ© 20,000 ÿØÿ±ŸáŸÖ ŸÑŸáÿ∞ÿß ÿßŸÑÿπŸÖŸäŸÑÿå ŸàŸáŸä ÿßŸÑÿ¢ŸÜ ŸÅŸä ÿßŸÑÿ∑ÿ±ŸäŸÇ ÿ•ŸÑŸäŸá. ŸÖŸÜ ŸÅÿ∂ŸÑŸÉŸÖÿå ÿßÿ∞Ÿáÿ®Ÿàÿß ÿßŸÑÿ¢ŸÜ ŸàŸÇŸàŸÖŸàÿß ÿ®ÿ™ÿ≠ÿµŸäŸÑ Ÿáÿ∞ÿß ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ®ŸÑÿ∫."

ŸáŸÉÿ∞ÿß ÿ™ÿ™ÿ≠ŸàŸÑ ÿπŸÖŸÑŸäÿ© "ÿßŸÑÿ®Ÿäÿπ" ÿ•ŸÑŸâ "ÿ£ŸÖŸàÿßŸÑ ŸÜŸÇÿØŸäÿ© ŸÅŸä ÿßŸÑÿ®ŸÜŸÉ". Ÿàÿ≠ÿØÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ®Ÿäÿπÿßÿ™ ŸàÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿàÿ≤Ÿäÿπ ŸáŸä ÿßŸÑÿ¨ÿ≥ÿ± ÿßŸÑÿ∞Ÿä Ÿäÿ≠ŸàŸÑ "ÿ™ŸàÿµŸäŸÑ ÿßŸÑŸÖŸÜÿ™ÿ¨" ÿ•ŸÑŸâ "ÿ•Ÿäÿ±ÿßÿØÿßÿ™ ÿ≠ŸÇŸäŸÇŸäÿ©" ŸÑŸÑÿ¥ÿ±ŸÉÿ©.

 

 ÿßŸÑÿπŸÇŸÑ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿØÿ®ÿ± Ÿàÿ±ÿßÿ° ÿ™ÿ≥ÿπŸäÿ±ÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÖŸÜÿ™ÿ¨

ŸÑŸÖÿßÿ∞ÿß Ÿäÿ≠ÿµŸÑ ÿπŸÖŸäŸÑ ŸÅŸä ÿßŸÑÿØÿßÿ± ÿßŸÑÿ®Ÿäÿ∂ÿßÿ° ÿπŸÑŸâ ÿÆÿµŸÖ 10% ÿ®ŸäŸÜŸÖÿß ŸäÿØŸÅÿπ ÿπŸÖŸäŸÑ ÿ¢ÿÆÿ± ŸÅŸä ÿßŸÑÿ±ÿ®ÿßÿ∑ ÿßŸÑÿ≥ÿπÿ± ŸÉÿßŸÖŸÑÿßŸãÿü ŸÑŸÖÿßÿ∞ÿß ŸäŸàÿ¨ÿØ ÿπÿ±ÿ∂ "ÿßÿ¥ÿ™ÿ±Ÿê ŸÇÿ∑ÿπÿ© Ÿàÿßÿ≠ÿµŸÑ ÿπŸÑŸâ ÿßŸÑÿ´ÿßŸÜŸäÿ© ŸÖÿ¨ÿßŸÜŸãÿß" ŸÅŸä ŸÜŸáÿßŸäÿ© Ÿáÿ∞ÿß ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿ≥ÿ®Ÿàÿπ ŸÅŸÇÿ∑ÿü

Ÿáÿ∞ÿß ŸÑŸäÿ≥ ÿ≥ÿ≠ÿ±Ÿãÿßÿõ ÿ•ŸÜŸáÿß ÿ¢ŸÑŸäÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ™ÿ≥ÿπŸäÿ± ŸÅŸä Ÿàÿ≠ÿØÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ®Ÿäÿπÿßÿ™ ŸàÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿàÿ≤Ÿäÿπ. ŸäŸÇŸàŸÖ ŸÖÿ≥ÿ™ÿ¥ÿßÿ± ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ®Ÿäÿπÿßÿ™ ŸàÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿàÿ≤Ÿäÿπ ÿ®ÿ®ŸÜÿßÿ° ŸÉŸÑ Ÿáÿ∞Ÿá ÿßŸÑŸÇŸàÿßÿπÿØ ŸàÿßŸÑÿ¥ÿ±Ÿàÿ∑ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿπŸÇÿØÿ©. Ÿàÿ®ŸÖÿ¨ÿ±ÿØ ÿ•ÿØÿÆÿßŸÑ ÿßŸÑÿ∑ŸÑÿ®ÿå ŸäŸÇŸàŸÖ ÿßŸÑŸÜÿ∏ÿßŸÖ ÿ™ŸÑŸÇÿßÿ¶ŸäŸãÿß ÿ®ÿ≠ÿ≥ÿßÿ® ÿßŸÑÿ≥ÿπÿ± ÿßŸÑŸÜŸáÿßÿ¶Ÿäÿå ŸàÿßŸÑÿ∂ÿ±ÿßÿ¶ÿ®ÿå ŸàÿßŸÑÿÆÿµŸàŸÖÿßÿ™ÿå Ÿàÿ™ŸÉÿßŸÑŸäŸÅ ÿßŸÑÿ¥ÿ≠ŸÜ. ÿ•ŸÜŸá ÿßŸÑÿπŸÇŸÑ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ±ŸÉÿ≤Ÿä ÿßŸÑÿ∞Ÿä Ÿäÿ∂ŸÖŸÜ ÿ£ŸÜ ÿßŸÑÿ≥ÿπÿ± ÿµÿ≠Ÿäÿ≠ 100% ŸÑŸÉŸÑ ÿπŸÖŸäŸÑÿå ŸàŸÅŸä ŸÉŸÑ ÿ∑ŸÑÿ®.

 

 ÿ™ÿ¨Ÿäÿ® ÿπŸÑŸâ ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿ≥ÿ¶ŸÑÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÉÿ®ÿ±Ÿâ ŸÑŸÑŸÖÿØŸäÿ± ÿßŸÑÿπÿßŸÖ

ŸÜÿ∏ÿ±Ÿãÿß ŸÑÿ£ŸÜ ŸÉŸÑ ÿπŸÖŸÑŸäÿ© ÿ®Ÿäÿπÿå ÿµÿ∫Ÿäÿ±ÿ© ŸÉÿßŸÜÿ™ ÿ£ŸÖ ŸÉÿ®Ÿäÿ±ÿ©ÿå ÿ™ŸÖÿ± ÿπÿ®ÿ± Ÿàÿ≠ÿØÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ®Ÿäÿπÿßÿ™ ŸàÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿàÿ≤Ÿäÿπÿå ŸÅÿ•ŸÜŸáÿß ÿ™ÿ≠ÿ™ŸÅÿ∏ ÿ®ÿ£ÿ´ŸÖŸÜ ŸÉŸÜÿ≤ ŸÑŸÑÿ¥ÿ±ŸÉÿ©: ÿßŸÑÿ®ŸäÿßŸÜÿßÿ™. ÿπŸÜÿØŸÖÿß Ÿäÿ±ŸäÿØ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿØŸäÿ± ÿßŸÑÿπÿßŸÖ ŸàŸÅÿ±ŸäŸÇ ÿßŸÑÿ•ÿØÿßÿ±ÿ© ŸÖÿπÿ±ŸÅÿ© Ÿàÿ∂ÿπ ÿßŸÑÿ¥ÿ±ŸÉÿ©ÿå ŸÅÿ•ŸÜŸáŸÖ Ÿäÿ∑ÿ±ÿ≠ŸàŸÜ ÿ£ÿ≥ÿ¶ŸÑÿ© ŸÉÿ®Ÿäÿ±ÿ©ÿå ŸàŸàÿ≠ÿØÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ®Ÿäÿπÿßÿ™ ŸàÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿàÿ≤Ÿäÿπ ŸáŸä ÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿä ÿ™ŸÖÿ™ŸÑŸÉ ÿßŸÑÿ•ÿ¨ÿßÿ®ÿßÿ™:

"ŸÖÿß ŸáŸà ŸÖŸÜÿ™ÿ¨ŸÜÿß ÿßŸÑÿ£ŸÉÿ´ÿ± ŸÖÿ®ŸäÿπŸãÿß Ÿáÿ∞ÿß ÿßŸÑÿ¥Ÿáÿ±ÿü"

"ŸÖŸÜ ŸáŸÖ ÿ£ŸÉÿ®ÿ± 10 ÿπŸÖŸÑÿßÿ° ŸÑÿØŸäŸÜÿß ŸÖŸÜ ÿ≠Ÿäÿ´ ÿßŸÑÿ•Ÿäÿ±ÿßÿØÿßÿ™ÿü"

"ŸÖÿß ŸáŸä ÿßŸÑŸÖÿØŸäŸÜÿ© ÿ£Ÿà ÿßŸÑŸÖŸÜÿ∑ŸÇÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ¨ÿ∫ÿ±ÿßŸÅŸäÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿä ÿ™ÿ≠ŸÇŸÇ ÿ£ÿπŸÑŸâ ŸÖÿ®Ÿäÿπÿßÿ™ÿü"

ŸÉŸÑ ÿßŸÑÿ™ŸÇÿßÿ±Ÿäÿ± ÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿä ÿ™ŸÇŸàÿØ ÿßÿ≥ÿ™ÿ±ÿßÿ™Ÿäÿ¨Ÿäÿ© ÿßŸÑÿπŸÖŸÑ Ÿàÿ™ÿ≥ÿßÿπÿØ ÿπŸÑŸâ ÿßÿ™ÿÆÿßÿ∞ ÿßŸÑŸÇÿ±ÿßÿ± (ŸÖÿßÿ∞ÿß ŸÜÿ®Ÿäÿπ ÿ£ŸÉÿ´ÿ±ÿü ÿ£ŸäŸÜ ŸÜŸÅÿ™ÿ™ÿ≠ ŸÅÿ±ÿπŸãÿß ÿ¨ÿØŸäÿØŸãÿßÿü) ÿ™ÿ≥ÿ™ŸÖÿØ ÿ®ŸäÿßŸÜÿßÿ™Ÿáÿß ŸÖÿ®ÿßÿ¥ÿ±ÿ© ŸÖŸÜ Ÿàÿ≠ÿØÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ®Ÿäÿπÿßÿ™ ŸàÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿàÿ≤Ÿäÿπ.

ŸÉŸÖÿ≥ÿ™ÿ¥ÿßÿ± Ÿàÿ≠ÿØÿ© ŸÖÿ®Ÿäÿπÿßÿ™ ŸäŸÖŸÉŸÜ ÿ£ŸÜ ÿ£ŸÇŸàŸÑ ÿ®ŸÉŸÑ ÿ´ŸÇÿ© ÿ£ŸÜ Ÿáÿ∞Ÿá ÿßŸÑŸàÿ≠ÿØÿ© ŸáŸä ÿßŸÑÿ±ÿßÿ®ÿ∑ ÿßŸÑÿ≠ŸäŸàŸä ÿßŸÑÿ∞Ÿä Ÿäÿ¨ŸÖÿπ ŸÖŸÉŸàŸÜÿßÿ™ ÿ£Ÿä ÿ¥ÿ±ŸÉÿ©ÿå ŸÜÿ¥ÿßÿ∑Ÿáÿß ÿßŸÑÿ±ÿ¶Ÿäÿ≥Ÿä Ÿäÿ±ÿ™ŸÉÿ≤ ÿπŸÑŸâ ÿπŸÖŸÑŸäÿßÿ™ ÿßŸÑÿ®Ÿäÿπ.

entry.title: What Does an SAP Sales Consultant Actually Do?
entry.content:
You see the job title SAP SD Consultant everywhere. But what does that person actually do all day? If you ask a consultant, they‚Äôll probably say something like ‚ÄúI configure the system‚Äù or ‚ÄúI manage the Order-to-Cash process.‚Äù Which is true, but doesn‚Äôt really explain what the job feels like.

In simple terms, the SAP SD (Sales and Distribution) module covers everything from a customer‚Äôs order to delivery and billing. The SD consultant is the one who builds, maintains, and fixes that whole flow. You‚Äôre not a salesperson. You‚Äôre the person making sure the company can sell, without chaos.

So what do you really do? Here‚Äôs what the job looks like in real life.

  1. Understanding the business: 

    Before you touch SAP, you need to know what the business actually needs. That means talking to sales managers, warehouse guys, finance teams ‚Äî the people doing the real work.

    You don‚Äôt ask, ‚ÄúWhat do you want in SAP?‚Äù
     You ask, ‚ÄúHow do you work?‚Äù and ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs going wrong?‚Äù

    Example: The sales manager says, ‚ÄúWe need to give a 10% discount to any customer in Casablanca who buys more than 50 cases of our new soda.‚Äù  Now you ask the real questions: 50 cases per order or per month? All customers or specific ones? What if they return 10?

    That‚Äôs the real detective work.

  2. Building it in SAP:

    Once you understand the rule, you go into the system and make it real. This is configuration! not coding. You‚Äôre turning business logic into SAP logic.

    Example: You create a condition record that tells the system: If the customer is from Casablanca, the product is ‚ÄúNew Soda,‚Äù and the quantity is over 50, apply a 10% discount.

  3.  When SAP can‚Äôt do it: 

    Sometimes the business wants something too specific for SAP‚Äôs standard features. That‚Äôs when you write a ‚Äúfunctional spec‚Äù, a document for the developer explaining exactly what needs to be built.

    Example: They want a report that emails all orders with that 10% discount every day at 5 PM. You describe the layout, the data sources (tables like VBAK, KNA1, KONV), and the logic behind it. Then the developer codes it.

  4.  Testing everything: 

    After you build or the developer finishes, you test it. And you test it again. You make sure every possible scenario behaves as expected.

    Example:

    60 cases, Casablanca ‚Üí Discount applies.
    40 cases, Casablanca ‚Üí No discount.
    60 cases, Rabat ‚Üí No discount.
  5. Supporting users: 

    Once the system goes live, things break. Orders get stuck, deliveries fail, prices go crazy. That‚Äôs when users call you.

    Example: A sales clerk says an order is blocked: ‚ÄúCredit limit exceeded.‚Äù You check the credit data, find out finance hasn‚Äôt cleared a payment, explain it, and unblock the issue.

    That‚Äôs day-to-day life.
  6. Teaching people: 

    You also train users and write simple guides: screenshots, short steps, nothing fancy.

    Example: After you create that discount report, you show sales managers how to open it, read it, and use it. Then you leave them with a short guide.

So, what‚Äôs the job really?

An SAP SD Consultant is the bridge between business and system. You understand how the company sells, then make SAP follow that logic. You listen, you build, you test, you fix, and you teach.
That‚Äôs it. That‚Äôs the real job!

entry.title: How to configure automatic G/L account selection for outgoing payments in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud,
entry.content:
When posting outgoing or incoming payments, after i choose bank account, there's the option to also select the GL account. Kindly find attached the screenshot. How do i configure the system to automatically choose outgoing payment GL when its an outgoing payment and incoming payment GL when its an incoming payment. I dont want to have to manually input this when creating payment.

Please note that i have created the reconciliation GL and have maintained the two subaccounts. I have also connected the reconciliation GL to the bank account.

entry.title: Phase control possible between phase 5&6??
entry.content:
Hi All

We are live in sap4hana public cloud since 1/5/25 and use EAM to the max

Our consultant highlighted we can not have phase control between phase 5&6. As a result we have 

- 1 phase control which is overkill

- 1 phase control we DO want but do not have (teamlead approval of WOs before PRs are issued/wo is released)

I read everywhere (e.g. below) you can just add phase controls. Can someone confirm this and are there nuances we should be aware of (e.g. linked to C&P process, PR to PO process)?

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/asset-management-in-sap-s-4hana-cloud-2102/ba-p/13513172

entry.title: Re: Information Steward repository table Details
entry.content:
The description of all Information Steward tables can be found in table MMT_Table.

SELECT
	mt.technical_name,
	mt.description
FROM
	<database>.<schema>.MMT_Table AS mt

entry.title: Re: How to Call RAP Actions with Table Types from a List Report
entry.content:
@Ashishkumar_Mouria 

According to the help document,

OData V2 only allows non-standard operations with flat parameters. The service binding shows an error message if a non-standard operation with a deep parameter is included in the service.

entry.title: Re: Reimagining Certification for the Way We Work Today
entry.content:
Hi @neilaspin ,

thanks for your open feedback. Pls understand that these first 6 exams were launched as pilot exams and we're working through what you called so nicely 'teething problems'. For the genAI one specifically we received feedback from many learners that the instructions were not clear enough and have taken it down and are improving it at the moment. It will be back online shortly. I hence encourage you to try the next version again which is being thoroughly reviewed. Expected Nov. 25. With regard to the missing score report, this is something on the near roadmap and I need to ask you to be patient a bit longer. 

Thanks for learning with us and for taking the time to give feedback. 
Best,
Diana

entry.title: Re: How to configure automatic G/L account selection for...
entry.content:
Hi seunabati,
As you explain when posting outgoing or incoming payments, after i choose bank account even though you‚Äôve already set up the reconciliation account and linked it to the bank account. Please follow the step by step configuration as i show you below.

1. Bank Account Master Data (Manage Bank Accounts App)
In the bank account master record, you can assign:Main Bank Reconciliation Account (already done in your case). Payment Subaccounts for Incoming and Outgoing flows. These subaccounts are what the system uses to automatically post to the correct GL when you create payments.

2. Assign Payment Methods
Go to Manage Payment Methods for Company Code.
For each payment method (e.g., wire transfer, check, SEPA), assign: The Bank Account. The GL Subaccount (Incoming or Outgoing). This ensures that when you select a payment method, the system knows which GL account to hit.

3. Automatic Account Determination
In SSCUI (Self-Service Configuration UI) for Bank Accounting, check: Define House Banks and Account IDs ‚Üí link the bank account ID to the reconciliation account and subaccounts. Define Posting Rules ‚Üí specify which GL account is used for debit (outgoing) and credit (incoming).

4. Payment Transactions
When you post an outgoing payment, the system looks at: The payment method + bank account ID ‚Üí derives the outgoing subaccount. When you post an incoming payment, the same logic applies but points to the incoming subaccount.

Hope you will get the issue resolved.
